docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 14. -- Exports from the United States to South America and Oceania declined slightly in March, compared with March, 1935, but shipment to all other geographical divisions increased, the Department of Commerce reported today on the...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 14. -- Exports from the United States to South America and Oceania declined slightly in March, compared with March, 1935, but shipment to all other geographical divisions increased, the Department of Commerce reported today on the basis of statistics corrected to May 12. Imports increased from all major geographical divisions except South America and Africa.
docs.abstract: Mar, by geographical divs and classified groups

headline.main: FOREIGN TRADE UP IN MARCH OVER 1935; But Exports of $194,792,000 Were Less Than Month's Imports of $198,686,000. CANADIAN BUSINESS GAINS United Kingdom and Soviet Union Also Took More and Sent More to This Country.

docs.snippet: Last week's foreign exchange market was notable for the hasty covering of "shorts" in the French franc predicated on the statement of Leon Blum, Leftist leader, of "resolute hostility" to devaluation of the franc.
docs.lead_paragraph: Last week's foreign exchange market was notable for the hasty covering of "shorts" in the French franc predicated on the statement of Leon Blum, Leftist leader, of "resolute hostility" to devaluation of the franc.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED MAY 16, 1936

docs.snippet: A total of $1,825,403,600, or 34 per cent of the $5,345,449,590 of foreign dollar bonds outstanding on Dec. 31, last, was then in default either as to interest or sinking-fund payment or both, according to the second annual report of the Foreign...
docs.lead_paragraph: A total of $1,825,403,600, or 34 per cent of the $5,345,449,590 of foreign dollar bonds outstanding on Dec. 31, last, was then in default either as to interest or sinking-fund payment or both, according to the second annual report of the Foreign Bondholders Protective Council, Inc., given out for today.

headline.main: FOREIGN DEBT HERE IS 34% IN DEFAULT; $1,825,403,600 Bonds of 24 Nations Found Delinquent on Interest or Sinking Fund. LATIN AMERICA LEADS LIST Indifference Revealed in a Study by Foreign Bondholders' Council. FOREIGN DEBT HERE IS 34% IN DEFAULT

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 19. -- A list of proposals that, if adopted, would mean the formation of an association or league of nations in North and South America was submitted today by the governing board of the Pan American Union for consideration at the...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 19. -- A list of proposals that, if adopted, would mean the formation of an association or league of nations in North and South America was submitted today by the governing board of the Pan American Union for consideration at the projected Pan-American Peace Conference to be held at Buenos Aires.
docs.abstract: Pan Amer Union submits list of proposals divided into 6 groups; list
